intro: Consolida staminosa, commonly known as the common honesty, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The seeds of Consolida staminosa are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural spread across various habitats.
